structured.description: A web server using FastAPI and initializes database schema from models. It includes two routers for handling user and remember routes respectively. The server allows CORS requests from specified origins and returns a "hello world!" message when accessing the root URL.

items.description: Returns a JSON object with the message "hello world!" when accessed via an HTTP GET request to the root URL ("/") of a web application. This suggests that it serves as a simple, default endpoint for the application.

returns.description: A Python dictionary containing two key-value pairs: 'message' mapped to the string "hello world!".

items.name: root
